SEARCH
Package game.mills

Class MoveValidator

java.lang.Object
game.mills.MoveValidator
public class MoveValidator extends Object
The MoveValidator class is responsible for validating player moves and placements on the game board. It checks whether a move or placement is valid based on the current game state and rules.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MoveValidator(Board board)
    Constructs a MoveValidator object associated with a game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • MoveValidator

      public MoveValidator(Board board)
      Constructs a MoveValidator object associated with a game board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board that the validator will use to check moves and placements.

  • Method Details

    • isValidPlacement

      public boolean isValidPlacement(Player player, int nodeID)
      Validates whether the given player can place a stone at the specified node. The placement is valid if the player has stones left to place and the node is not occupied.
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to place a stone.
      nodeID - the ID of the node where the player wants to place the stone.
      Returns:
      true if the placement is valid, false otherwise.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(Player player, int nodeFrom, int nodeTo)
      Validates whether the given player can move a stone from one node to another. A move is valid if the destination node is adjacent to the source node, or if the player is allowed to "fly" (i.e., the player has exactly 3 stones on the board).
      Parameters:
      player - the player attempting to make the move.
      nodeFrom - the ID of the node where the stone is currently located.
      nodeTo - the ID of the node where the player wants to move the stone.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • canFly

      public boolean canFly(Player player)
      Checks if the given player can "fly," which allows the player to move a stone to any open node on the board. A player is allowed to fly if they have exactly 3 stones left on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose ability to fly is being checked.
      Returns:
      true if the player can fly, false otherwise.
